body_html:
Please see the section "4.7.1. Default Argument Values". The following is the last example of that section.

If you don’t want the default to be shared between subsequent calls, you can write the function like this instead:

def f(a, L=None):
    if L is None:
        L = []
    L.append(a)
    return L

If you don’t want the default to be shared between subsequent calls, you can write the function like this instead:

body:
Please see the section "4.7.1. Default Argument Values". The following is the last example of that section.

```
If you don’t want the default to be shared between subsequent calls, you can write the function like this instead:

def f(a, L=None):
    if L is None:
        L = []
    L.append(a)
    return L
```
